title: About Me
text:
Background
I am a junior at BYU studying Statistics with an emphasis in Data Science! I’m interested in finding patterns in data and using them to make data driven decisions.
Some of my previous coursework projects include:

Bayesian Inference for Competitive Balance (Oct–Dec 2025): Built a Beta-Binomial hierarchical model to estimate NBA conference win probabilities; processed 200+ game records and quantified uncertainty with Monte Carlo simulations.

Comparative Player Performance Modeling (Mar–Apr 2025): Scraped and cleaned NBA game logs, created visual analytics, and developed matched-opponent comparisons to fairly evaluate MVP candidates.

Mixed-Effects ANOVA for HCI Study (Oct–Dec 2024): Designed and analyzed a typing-speed experiment with mixed-effects models; led team in data collection, diagnostics, and presentation.

In addition to my academic work, I completed my Eagle Scout project, where I built a garden plot and benches for a Civil War museum, leading the planning, construction, and coordination with museum staff.

title: About Me
text:
Education

BS in Statistics - Brigham Young University, 2027
Relevant Coursework: Probability and Inference, Statistical Methods, Bayesian Analysis, Data Wrangling, Linear and Computational Algebra, Data Visualization, Data Science Processes.

title: About Me
text:
Skills & Interests

Technical Skills

Programming: Python, R, Bash
Data Analysis: Pandas, NumPy, R
Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, ggplot2
Machine Learning: Scikit-learn
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Git/GitHub



Areas of Interest

Sports Analytics
Machine Learning
Financial Analytics

title: About Me
text:
Goals
In the short term I want to better integrate machine learning into my skill set and gain more practical experience with cleaning data and visualization. In the future I hope to apply analytics to improve player performance, strategy, and team decision making on a major sports team.

title: Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
text:
Welcome to my data science portfolio! This site shows my journey learning data science and analytics. Here you’ll find projects that demonstrate what I’ve learned and discovered. Learn more about me here


This portfolio shows my work learning data science. Each project includes:

My code with documentation
Visualizations I created
What I learned and discovered

I built this site using Quarto and host it on GitHub Pages.




Programming: Python, Pandas for data analysis
Visualization: Creating charts with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Data Collection: Getting data from files, websites, and APIs
Analysis: Finding patterns and answering questions with data







Learn how I explore datasets to find interesting patterns and answer questions.



See how I gather data from different sources and prepare it for analysis.



See how I tackle a data science project beginning to end.



Thanks for visiting! Feel free to explore my projects and see what I’m learning.

title: About Me
text:
Get To Know Me
I’m a passionate sports fan, cheering for the Cleveland Browns**, Indiana Pacers, and BYU. I enjoy staying active through playing basketball and running. I love board games and trivia and was on the trivia team in high school when I memorized every capital of every country in the world (I still remember most of them). I also love the outdoors, I camp, hike, and fish with my brother often.
